messages.title: Local Education
messages.content: I will campaign to ensure that resources are spent effectively - on the pupils and schools that need them not on empty buildings.

messages.title: Local Business
messages.content: Local businesses will be supported so they can thrive.

messages.title: Local People
messages.content: I am a community activist and will always put the needs of our community first.

messages.title: Local Environment
messages.content: Protecting the local environment is key for ensuring the area's future.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Campaigned with parents and teachers to secure funding for the redevelopment of James Gillespie's and Boroughmuir High School. Mike has also worked with students as they opposed tuition fees.
Campaign to save the Strathville Gate Post Offices - Warrender Park road was sadly closed by the Labour Government.
Stood up for local people with planning issues including Aivalney Terrace whent the planning department failed to notify residents of a large planning application.

Introduced a plastic bag levy bill to parliament to reduce packaging waste. Sadly the Labour party refused to support the bill. Campaigned for a strong climate change bill with legally binding targets. Voted to ban snaring at the Scottish Parliament.

mentions.tacticalSituation: 4th place Conservatives can't win here! 3rd place SNP can't win here!

issues.education: Campaigned with parents and teachers to secure funding for redevelopment. Worked with students as they opposed tuition fees.
issues.environment: Introduced a plastic bag levy bill to parliament to reduce packaging waste. Campaigned for a strong climate change bill with legally binding targets. Voted to ban snaring at the Scottish Parliament.
issues.governance: Stood up for local people with planning issues.

leaflet.personalStatement: Mike has lived and worked locally for over 40 years.

politicalExperience.achievements: Helped thousands of local people through casework and advice. Local successes have included saving John Livingston's Tomb and Arthur Conan Doyle's house from developers.

images.caption: Mike discussing the challenges in local business at Eddie's Fish Market. Mike has a known interest in Edinburgh issues and the challenges they face.

Mike talking to local residents at John Livingston's Tomb after a long campaign to keep it open as a general facility for the public. Mike has helped thousands of local people and communities across South Edinburgh.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Don't Forget Labour's legacy: Illegal war in Iraq cost the lives of hundreds of thousands. Labour's education cuts have cost the UK dearly. Labour's debt is a growing debt needing a remedy.
